pr_title: Make TopicReplicationFactorAnomalyFinder ignore topic with large minISR.

timeline.message: Make TopicReplicationFactorAnomalyFinder ignore topic with large minISR.

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Topics which have at least one partition detected to violate replication factor requirement -> Topics, which have at least one partition that violates replication factor requirements.
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Can we indicate what we mean by badTopics in the JavaDoc?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Why do we explicitly pass _badTopicsByReplicationFactor  to populateTopicPatternByReplicationFactor, which would already have access to this variable w/o passing it?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Nit (conciseness): Detected following topics having replication factor violations -> Topics with replication factor (RF) violations?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText:
Nit (conciseness): (key, value) -> sb.append(String.format("{target replication factor %d, topics violated %s}, ", key, value)));
-> (key, value) -> sb.append(String.format("{With desired RF %d: %s}, ", key, value)));?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText:
Nit (seems a little verbose to me): String.format("{Topic: %s, violation ratio %f%%}", _topicName, _violationRatio * 100.0); -> String.format("{%s(%.2f)}", _topicName, _violationRatio * 100.0);
Also if violation ratio is 1, can we avoid printing the ratio? I assume in the typical case, we expect to see this ratio as 1. This may make the plaintext response cleaner.
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Nit (code convention): Can we drop get from getters?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: This is not clear. What does the former refer to in this sentence? Can we put bullet points in JavaDoc to clearly explain each case?
